page.title: 05FUNDENHALL
page.content: {Fundenhall is truly rural.}Planning regulations ban new residential buildings unless for agricultural occupancy, therefore houses are mostly old cottages & farms.Land is either under a non-grass crop or managed grassland for the 300 head Manor Farm dairy herd or the Hunter horses of Fundenhall Grange.There are many man-made ponds called pits.A few lanes cross the area and 1 B class road part of which is still called the Turnpike, a relic of toll collecting days.Brick Kiln Lane is known locally as Bricky Lane. The Post Office is in a private house but the school is long closed. St. Nicholas Church has a fortnightly service with more parishioners attending its special services.
